quizzes.question_text: Put these numbers in order from greatest to least.
solution: To put numbers in order from greatest to least, we need to find the largest number first, then the second largest, and keep going until we find the smallest.
Look at all the numbers: 82, 11, 38, 87, 13. To compare them, start by looking at the tens place. 87 and 82 both have 8 in the tens place, which is bigger than the others.
Between 87 and 82, look at the ones place: 7 is bigger than 2, so 87 is the largest and 82 is the second largest.
For the remaining numbers, 38 has 3 in the tens place, while 13 and 11 have 1, so 38 comes next in the order after 82.
Finally, between 13 and 11, both have 1 in the tens place, so look at the ones place: 3 is bigger than 1. Thus 13 is larger than 11 and 11 is the smallest.
The order from greatest to least is: 87, 82, 38, 13, 11.

quizzes.question_text: Put these numbers in order from greatest to least.
solution: To put numbers in order from greatest to least, we need to find the largest number first, then the second largest, and keep going until we find the smallest.
Look at all the numbers: 456, 791, 472, 763, 248. All numbers have 3 digits. Start by comparing the hundreds place to group similar numbers.
The largest number is 791 because it has the highest value when comparing digit by digit from left to right.
Continue comparing: 763 is the second largest, followed by 472 in third place.
Finally, comparing 456 and 248, we find that 456 is larger than 248. Therefore, 248 is the smallest.
The order from greatest to least is: 791, 763, 472, 456, 248.

The order from least to greatest is: 226, 268, 287, 384, 835.

solution: To put numbers in order from greatest to least, we need to find the largest number first, then the second largest, and keep going until we find the smallest.
Look at all the numbers: 708, 304, 204, 956, 920. All numbers have 3 digits. Start by comparing the hundreds place to group similar numbers.
The largest number is 956 because it has the highest value when comparing digit by digit from left to right.
Continue comparing: 920 is the second largest, followed by 708 in third place.
Finally, comparing 304 and 204, we find that 304 is larger than 204. Therefore, 204 is the smallest.
The order from greatest to least is: 956, 920, 708, 304, 204.

quizzes.question_text: Put these numbers in order from least to greatest.
solution: To put numbers in order from least to greatest, we need to find the smallest number first, then the second smallest, and keep going until we find the largest.
Look at all the numbers: 515, 624, 772, 820, 188. All numbers have 3 digits. Start by comparing the hundreds place to find the smallest.
The smallest number is 188 because it has the lowest value when comparing digit by digit from left to right.
Continue comparing: 515 is the second smallest, followed by 624 in third place.
Finally, comparing 772 and 820, we find that 820 is larger than 772. Therefore, 820 is the largest.
The order from least to greatest is: 188, 515, 624, 772, 820.

quizzes.question_text: Put these numbers in order from least to greatest.
solution: To put numbers in order from least to greatest, we need to find the smallest number first, then the second smallest, and keep going until we find the largest.
Look at all the numbers: 66, 42, 60, 17, 24. To compare them, start by looking at the tens place. Numbers with smaller tens digits come first.
The smallest number is 17 because it has the lowest value when comparing digit by digit from left to right.
Continue comparing: 24 is the second smallest, followed by 42 in third place.
Finally, comparing 60 and 66, we find that 66 is larger than 60. Therefore, 66 is the largest.
The order from least to greatest is: 17, 24, 42, 60, 66.
